Our planet faces urgent environmental challenges, including climate change, deforestation, extinction of species, pollution, and resource depletion. These crises are largely a result of an exploitative mindset that views nature as a resource separate from us. This disconnect has led to widespread, degradation. A new perspective is urgently required, one that fosters unity rather than division between humanity, mankind, and mother nature.

Advaita or non dualism teaches that all of existence is one. It rejects the illusion of separateness between self and the universe and the cosmos. Emphasizing that the individual and nature are interconnected, this philosophy views nature not as an external entity to be exploited and used, but as an extension of our own selves. The boundaries between us and them, human beings and the environment disappear revealing a profound oneness of both these elements. This panel today will explore how Advaita provides a transformative lens to address environmental issues by recognizing the oneness between humanity and nature.

Advaita challenges the prevailing attitude of dominance over nature. Advaita proposes that true well-being can only be achieved when we see the health of the planet as the health of our own body. This panel will examine both the spiritual and the practical aspects of exploring how this ancient wisdom of Advaita can guide modern environmental solutions.
